term.title: contamination

item.text: Carry-over from a preceding sample probe into a following specimen cup, which will influence not just one result, but all assays on that specimen, or with that reagent.

sources.item: PAC, 1991, 63, 301. 'Proposals for the description and measurement of carry-over effects in clinical chemistry (Recommendations 1991)' on page 302 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199163020301)

term.citation: Citation: 'contamination' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.C01295

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
